c74object.name: fl.store~
c74object.digest: Stores frames remotely for later recall
c74object.description: The storage location is determined by the name parameter. The output / ordering input can be used to explicitly control ordering between related objects. In a multistream scenario each stream has separate storage for a given name.

entry.name: /name [instantiation string]
entry.description: Sets the name of the storage to use. Note that names are local to the current context.

objarg.name: name
objarg.digest: Sets the name of the storage to use
objarg.description:
This argument sets the name parameter:
Sets the name of the storage to use. Note that names are local to the current context.

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.store~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

method.name: frame
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

method.name: sync
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.store~. When set to 0 fl.store~ can form part of a non-realtime network for processing in message threads, using buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.store~.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
